newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: BOTSWANA STOCKS WEEK - DOMESTIC MKT CONTINUES STRONG.
newsitem.headline: BOTSWANA STOCKS WEEK - DOMESTIC MKT CONTINUES STRONG.

text.p: All but three of the 12 domestic
stocks listed on the Botswana Stock Exchange (BSE) traded up
last week as the market gained 17.11 points to close at 459.86
points.
Brewery holding company Sechaba jumped 9.3 per cent
to close at 350 thebe on the back of a large order from an
overseas institutional investor while Barclays
continued its strong run and ended up 20 thebe at 750 thebe.
Standard Chartered advanced 45 thebe to close at 630
thebe and Botswana Insurance rose 25 thebe to 245 thebe
following good results.
First National traded up 10 thebe to 510. A large
block of investment company Kgolo ya Sechaba traded at
190 thebe, up five thebe on the week.
Food and tobacco wholesaler Metsef climbed 10 thebe
to close at 660 thebe, clothing chain Pep rose five
thebe to finish the week at 305 thebe and milling company and
food wholesaler Sefalana continued its good run closing
the week at 445 thebe.
Unchanged were security group Inco trading at 90
thebe and variable loan stock counter RDC Properties at
170 thebe.
Engen was untraded at 445/475 thebe.
Turnover was down with 563,475 shares changing hands from
864,745 previously, valued at 1,701,510 pula over 3,780,322 pula
before.
On the foreign, dual-listed board, De Beers was the
only counter traded, in a small parcel of 320 shares at 12,719
thebe, but down 35 thebe on the week.
